column2: When bathing at surf beach & lost togs.

After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was  
very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.

After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I always  
trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps  
coming nearer.

Foreign students playing loud music in the night before the  
biology examn.
Almost always when I go to fetch the results of an exam.
Scoring a goal in football match.

As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - it  
dying.

When a boy put a handful of cooked potatoes down my dress and  
there was no water to clean up.
My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).

I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she  
went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It  
was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who  
had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we  
went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.

My older brother who gives me unwanted advices about problems in  
my relationship with my girlfriend.

I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems  
and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by  
the irreversibility of the decision.

I felt it when I received a letter telling that I had been  
classified in a national concourse of p... I felt happy and  
vanity about it.

My friend and I had offended our classmate unintenionally.  We  
wanted to apologize to her so we decided to visit her.  We knew that she  
was stubborn so we were frightened.  When we rang her door bell,  
our fear was at it's climax

During 7th grade our class mobbed a famale teacher so badly that  
she had a breackdown and was hospitalized.

On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day,  
beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.

I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my  
father took his purse and payed.

When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep  
the promise.

At the funeral of a friend about 20 years old, who was killed in  
a hit-and-run motorcycle accident.
After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.

During the summer I received grade cards from my TA's. I expected  
a B no better in Computer Science. I looked at the card - I got an  
A - I was ecstatic.

When I saw a good friend again after not having seen her for a  
long time.
I was very fat, and was ashamed of my body.

This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees  
with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I  
always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so  
much over unimportant trivial matters.

Disagreements with mother.  When I moved from KankaanpSS, she had  
promised to help me move but broke her promise because of some  
hindrance.
Friends calling me fat - pear shaped in front of a nice girl.

About the car (sadness) I felt anger the way I acted after  
negotiating it.

When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I  
was stopped from punching him for it.

Leaving a friend of mine alone at a dance - I felt I should have  
kept her company.
First day back on the job.

When I was doing my homework at home, some relatives came and  
advised me to help my mother do the house-work.

I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the moment  
I wanted to leave, my father said I couldn't go because he needed  
me for some work in the afternoon.

In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's  
birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get  
drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit,  
but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in  
moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed  
drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had  
to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home  
and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I  
didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.

Walking through campus at night a squirrel jumped in front of  
me.

I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard  
about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.

One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I  
was sure that I had done no such thing.
Shame I feel when I am not properly dressed.
When my behaviour was immoral - thinking about sex.
When my friend, after a beer spree vomitted in my sitting room.

Saw on TV China not winning more gold medals in the Asian  
Olympics.

I ate a Runeberg's cake, though I knew that I would immediately  
put on a kilo.

I had a friend who was very kind to me.  I tried my best to like  
him and understand him but when I was with him I could not help  
rejecting, criticizing and blaming him.  I wanted to get away  
from him as soon as possible.

After I reluctantly refused to dine with a certain man on the  
same table.

I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty  
at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being  
a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this  
emotion)
I fell outside the door of my house.

Before one of my final exams of the third year - natural  
sciences.
When my mother died in August 1978.

I had fear when I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I had  
problems of how to move to this place.

I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in my  
friend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual and  
moral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then,  
I felt it in my soul.

Once I offended a friend, instead of her coming to me to ask and  
discuss the matter she was just telling other people about it and  
say all she could about me.

When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in  
my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the   
morning for manual work.

I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed  
towards the precipice along the road.

Many years ago I saw the film "Psycho" by Hitchcock for the first  
time. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardly  
dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep.

Guilt after fighting with my sister (for) telling her how bad she  
was.

Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and  
difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.

After attending a song contest proposed by a band called "Chyne"  
we (6 of us) waited for the members of the band to greet us in  
front of the stage.  We went out after a few minutes as it was  
time to close the hall.  We had been waiting at the entrance hall  
for ten minutes when three of the band members came out.  They  
were very excited to see us, one of them was so excited that he  
had tears in his eyes.  We felt very warm and close to each  
other.  They took us back into the hall and we talked freely.  We  
were together for about an hour and during this time we felt  
that they were very sincere.
I do not help out enough at home.
A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.

Going away for the weekend, leaving my College room open - when I  
returned several friends had had a party there, leaving the mess.

My friend had many female friends and I thought that they were  
his lovers.  I would scold him but he did not accept my advice.   
Later I learnt from his girlfriends that this was not true.  I  
felt ashamed at having misunderstood him.
Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.

When I was a child, I had a nightmare. At that time, I was not  
yet able to tell anybody about it, so I was very frightened. I  
could not explain myself all that and I had to deal with it by  
myself.

Some time ago I was disgusted with the "cleanness" of the  
refectory of our institute.

Some times I was ashamed of presenting seminaries or even to  
speak in class.
The death of a close relative.
When I got my B.A degree with first class.
Attitude to a related family.

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car.  
We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my  
friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly  
started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for  
me to go to Carinthia.
A very drunk person.

I wanted something in particular and did not get it, also there  
was no possibility of getting it.

After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my  
scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I  
realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.

I always feel guilty when I see my mother sad or fed up with  
life. I really dont know the reason.
When my friend (girl) went abroad for two years.

When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first time  
that someone so close to me had died.
Watching the Asian Olympic game (China winning).

Car accident. I let a 16-year old, incompetent parson take the  
wheel and I feel very guilty about what happened even though I  
suffered the worst injuries.

Flirting with other girls while I already had a very good  
relationship. When there are problems in my relationship, the  
flirting increases as does the feeling of guilt.

When we were able to afford a new sofa - a leather one which cost  
SEK 20000.  I had waited for it for 2-3 years.

When a professor of this faculty laughed at, and was suspicious of  
a composition written by a class-mate and me.

When I was 20 years old, I fell severely ill and was bed-ridden for  
6 months.  I felt very scared for my health and my studies.

I felt disgusted at my teams poor perfomance prior to league  
play.

The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my  
grade six.
Loss of close relative.

As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might  
get tetanus.

I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I  
had to go the outside toilet on my own.

My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and  
watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to  
turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and  
started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid  
that he would do us a harm.

While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the  
lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.
When I had to sleep in a bed at a hostel, which was full of dirt.

At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and  
by this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.

When I patronized a certain tavern which had prostitutes, it was  
almost a brothel.

A friend had promised me to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure I  
called her before we went. She told me that she had just promised  
another person to give him a lift.
Someone attacked me with a knife.

A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of his  
mother's death ages ago. He is really quiet and because it  
relates back to his childhood I feel sadness for him. He doesn't  
lead a normal life and it just seems unfair.
Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.

The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a  
song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song  
about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.
Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.
Passed the last exam.
For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.

My friend half-teasingly called me a bad nickname.  I felt  
insulted and kicked his hip in anger.  I was stable later and did  
not feel angry at him.  In fact I was afraid that the other  
friends who were with us would think that I was an intolerant  
person.  However I could not apologize, so I pretended that  
nothing had happened and smiled when I left.  My friend did not  
say anything but just watched me leave.
When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.

My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really  
happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me  
made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another  
person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she  
asked me.

I took a psych. experiment with a totally unappealing gay man as  
the experimentor, some homosexuals are funny or cute, but this  
guy was disgusting. Plus the experiment was about gays too.

I caught a "peeping tom" at my window when I was getting  
undressed.

On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near  
the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my  
girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me.  
He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I  
really did not like that.
Failed to do what I had promised.

When one of my parents insinuates something about the other  
(they are divorced).

Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through  
police.

In a social situation I became interested in a woman. We talked,  
we laughed, we enjoyed each other. She desappeared for a few  
minutes, and a little after appeared with an other man.
When two of my children were critically ill with measles.
When I had to talk with an important person about a job.
The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close  
friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being  
right dominated.

When I saw a T.V programme on animals in the film world  
(mistreated and used).

I don't use to lie to my parets about what I do, and the two  
times that I felt anger were when they doubted me I said that I  
was going to the club, and they didn't believe me because the day  
before they had met me at FLIPERAMA. I had the wish to kill them.
Getting to know that my uncle in America had a brain tumor.
First public speaking.

When Christmas holiday started, I felt very joyful when I  
finished my last exam.

China cannot let you give more lectures because you are needed in  
the specialist clinics. We are so backward in medicine.

[ When I act thinking that I know everything and I then realize  
that there were things I had not thought about, thus hurting  
others.]

I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad  
would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started  
getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very,  
very far away.

On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt  
on, he dansed, spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.
My friend misunderstood me.

When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in mining  
engineering, after having prayed one week in the church I was  
not even selected.

I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life  
films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain  
animals in this particular programme of the polar bear.
Insulted by a woman in public.

When I got my first unknown compound while doing my M.Sc  
research, I was very happy.  This is because my research was based  
on this type of reactions and compounds.

I was amongst a group of people talking about how the Maori  
people were stirrers and causing trouble in our country. I felt  
shame to be a pakeha when other pakehas had such narrow  
conservative views.
Insulted by my mother.

When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in  
it and threw it in the dust-bin.

I used to play with a group of classmates and I found out later  
that they were cheap in thought, behaviour and conduct - they  
would smoke, fight and speak foul language.  I thought that they  
destroyed the image of college students.

The emotion came to me when a certain girl who was not polite to  
her mother hit her sister severely.

I felt happy at the settlement of our marriage, even though we  
are from different socio-linguistic backgrounds our parents  
agreed to the wedding without any conflict or discussion.  We had   
thought that they would object to the wedding but it did not happen.

After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of  
support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.

One day, I discussed a very important question with A.  A  
suddenly declared that he would not accept my position and  
thought that he himself was right.  Moreover, he attacked   
strongly, not my opinion but me personally.

When I saw my brother in Church, and publically accept Jesus  
Christ as his saviour and Lord.

When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the  
examinations she was about to take.

When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a  
certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.

My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of  
amidophen.
Disgust of drunkers and of blood.

One night,when I was in primary 5 or 6, I felt thirsty so I  
fetched the thermos to pour a cup of water for myself.  Then I  
saw my brother lowering his head and I, jokingly, poured the        
water on his head.

At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off with  
a guy she knows I really like.

Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs being  
suspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.

When my mother's new husband treated her and my brothers and  
sisters badly.

When I was a young teenager (14)  my brother-in-law to be had  
made heavy advances to me.  I did not understand very well what  
it was all about but I reacted strongly and the feelings are  
still there.

When I was very young, one day, I was in the street with my  
father and brother.   While my father was talking to some  
friends, I saw a dog and began to pat it.  My father told me  
sharply to stop doing it because the dog had mange.  Then my  
brother told me that I would die and I could not stop crying  
after this.

I heard a broadcasting programme about parapsychology. The people  
in this programme used very difficult words which I couldn't  
understand. They acted exaggerated without showing any feeling.

Watching "11 am". They had a programme on the starving refugees.  
Their plight was a source of sadness for me.
Being mistreated by other people.
Taking a chemistry midterm.

I was walking to school and I passed by a red cross post where  
there were many soldiers.  They began to pass remarks at me.

I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having  
injured it badly.
Fighting with my father while drunk.
I did not reply to my friend's letter in time.

When I talked maliciously about a colleague at work to someone  
else.  Immediately afterwards I felt ashamed.

My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing  
and went out with him herself.

After I saw my family and good friends back after staying one  
year in a foreign country.
At my sister's wedding.

During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as a  
student, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job to  
assume my financial situation.

My roommate leaving my drawers in a mess after plowing thourgh  
them looking for something.

I felt glad to live again when I went to a meeting about the  
"Knowledge". There are 4 techniques of meditation that connect  
you with the essence of the human being.
When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.
When the Americans set their nucleaar missiles in Europe.

I had subscribed for this test. We were informed by our  
secretary where the test took place. We went over there and thought  
there was a course. So we went back again I felt ashamed that the  
secretary again should see me.

When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I  
respect.

I broke up with my boyfriend of seven months, but it was a very  
"indepth" relationship and so after feelings of grief and loss  
were over I felt an immense sadness.

I experienced shame when I failed to keep a promise to meet my  
friend at the bus depot. He later came and asked me why I had not  
turned up.

Finding out that some students are getting good reports they do  
not deserve.
When I learnt that my best friend had failed the exams.

When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives  
late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could  
have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.

I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatory  
attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out  
of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she  
took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate  
them. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.

I was watching TV with a friend. After the first film I wanted to  
watch another film on the same channel. My friend switched over  
to the other cannel without asking me what I wanted.

I was looking after a dying patient at work one night, a young  
woman, my colleague was talking to her relatives and .... to  
offer them any support emotionally, physically and then sent them  
down to the coffee shop to have a dinner rather than offering the  
facilities available for their use cause it involved her having  
to do some work. Seeing them again I felt disgusted at her  
attitude.

I live with my sister now and sometimes she angers me especially  
when she thinks I don't keep the apt. clean enough.
When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.

One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heard  
the roar of a lion near by and had to run for our lives.
When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.

In September 1984 I got two girls pregnant and the families of  
both the girls confronted me .  The fact was that my parents were  
around and I felt guilty answering some of the questions.

My mother suffers from a mental illness.  One night she was not  
feeling well and was sent to the hospital.  I was scared that  
she would die, and all night I was very sad and did not dare to  
close my eyes.
Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.

I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this  
was the second time.  One had a negative attitude towards the  
lecturer.

This happened when it was finally confirmed that I had stood  
first in the university for the M.A exams.  A few days before the  
official results were declared a clerk had brought the results  
unofficially.  So I had been expecting the results but the  
confirmation allowed me to legitimately feel happy at my  
success.

I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on  
it. I tried to fix it but could not.

When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom at  
home when I was preparing for my MCE examination during the  
night.

Going out with another girl besides my girlfriend and not telling  
her.
Confession to my parents about my involvement in a moped theft.
When I had an argument with a friend.
When my friends were rude to a girl.

When I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she  
had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome  
them.

When I heard that there is teasing and bulling at Secondary  
School.

When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given  
me.
Acting in a play at the orientation camp made me feel timid.

When a boy I hated most in our classroom took my T Jersey from my  
desk and put it on.

Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My  
life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it  
disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.

I noticed that Meryl Streep and I had similar cheekbones and jaw  
structure.

I felt disgusted when I was not given money for lunch at school  
by my father as a punishment for beating my little brother.

The way my husband and his family treated me - unfairly, cruelly,  
and unjustly.

My mother wrote me and said that I would not writ enough letters  
home.

I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault,  
everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he  
surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

When I made the winning goal during a very important football  
game.

Arguing with my younger cousin.  She is rather a nuisance but I  
felt sorry.
Insulted by the class leader.

My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, her  
eyesight was at stake.
Earth crake.

I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me,  
that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could  
not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.
A child beaten up by his mother.
Not acting on my promise.

I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I  
haven't done it.

Some of my friends had an argument.  I had earlier phoned one  
of them and that may have influenced him to argue.

When ,due to hunger and tiredness, I became generally irritated  
with my fiancee and made cutting remarks which really hurt him.   
Later I realized that my unfounded irritation had hurt the person  
I love most on earth.

A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better  
than she is.

I was making very strong statements about infidelity in couples.  
Then I discovered that one of my best friends, who had just been through  
a very sad case of mutual infidelity, was listening.
When I noticed the negative changes in a friend's behaviour.

When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but he  
did nothing to relieve the situation.

My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His  
death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.

When I had crossed Lilongwe forest I heard that there was a rabid  
hyena just near the path in the forest.

After training for an Australian championship competition for a  
year and then injuring myself 2 weeks before the competiotion.
When I took away my best friend's boyfriend.

I met my ex boyfriend by chance.  We separated a few months ago  
and I am now with a new boyfriend.  My ex boyfriend looked  
depressed, and I know I am not to be blamed.

The repression of rioting and non-rioting "Blacks" in South  
Africa by the police of that "Democracy".

When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the  
rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.
Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.

When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and  
up to this moment my sadness is still on.
When I fell in love.

My husband falls ill and does not follow the doctor's advice on  
the treatment or the diet control.
I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.

When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self -  
to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future  
daughter-in-law.

A few months back I had gone to my friend's place and they offered  
me tea and coffee.  I do not have the habit of drinking tea or  
coffee and so they offered me a glass of milk instead, so I felt ashamed.

The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to  
my norms of behaviour.
[ I am joyfull to be alive every night.]
When I accepted Jesus Christ as my personal saviour.

The news of the natural calamity, an earthquake in which hundreds   
of Mexican people died.

When I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed of  
my clothes, wristwatch and my pair of shoes. After investigations  
it was found that all the things were stolen by one of the boys  
in our hostel.

My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said  
mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.

Friend (male) hinted that my talking to other men at a pub was  
immoral. He implied that I should remain only with my boyfriend  
the entire evening.

My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at  
home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked  
on mucus secretions.

When some people, including me, are treated in a way which  
equates them to an animal or a thing.

I detested my father who was a drunkard.  He would rave,  
threaten and blame my mother and me.  He finally drove us away  
from home.

A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest along  
with him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while I  
had to face the situation.

This feeling comes frequently when I go out at night and tell my  
mother that I shall come back early. But then I get home a 5 or 6 a.m.
Someone vomited on the street.

I was walking one day and I met a man who wanted to ask me about  
my brother but I didn't stop to hear what he was saying. I was  
ashamed when I found him at home and he told my brother what had  
happened.
Lying to my cousin about the form five examination fees.

I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who  
suddenly ran into the street.  The fear came later when I      
realized what could have happened.

I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at  
home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our  
interaction and how it was no longer possible.  The limited scope  
of human life is sad.

I had enough time to do my assignment, and I did not do it well.   
When the lecturer scolded me, I had this feeling.

When I lied at home.   I told them that I was going to a  
Christian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.

When a good friend of me told me one evening that she didn't want  
to live anymore.

When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died  
because she was old, but because she lived in the last few years  
in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers -  
no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would be  
sitting in the "lliving" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I  
felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't.

4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were

The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.

When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and

When my friends and I were caught with our girlfriends outside

When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.
Meeting a loved man.
When somebody despised a friend of mine.

At my Summer job a new caretaker had been employed who was my age  
 but I preferred going out for lunch with the accounts personnel

I escaped from communicating with God for a long time.  I did not

Whenever I spoke to a female classmate I felt disgusted.  She

When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a few

Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations  
most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my  
microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one.
When my last relation broke up.

When I purposely locked my babysitter out of the house at age 4

There was a cat on the street.  It had been run over and its head was

When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of  
a sore on the leg.
When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.

I was taking a shower in a cubicle in France. Then I discovered  
that a few children were loking at me from the adjacent cubicle.

When my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. He

My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me

When I won an unexpected sum of money.

At using other people, because of sexual experience that was  
using another to the detriment of both. Anxiety that I may have

When I finished a test type of exam and did not dare to answer

When my brother ran away from home and I thought it was because

When I entered the dissection room for the first time and was

When I failed the S.S.C examination I felt very ashamed.
When I learnt that my close friend was going to immigrate.

When I saw a man who hadn't the lower .... in a car

I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason,  
they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and  
unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could  
manage things.

The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions  
going from a to e for each question.  She asked me to do all this  
in one and a half hours.  It involved a lot of describing and  
explaining and even though I knew all the answers, I could not  
finish the work.

When I got drunk at a party and made a fool of myself by  
vomitting all over the place and insulting the people who were

Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.
My sister marrying a bad man. He is cruel to her.

Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends  
was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming  
in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and  
prevent the accident.

A daughter in court for staff pilfering, she was dressed like a

falsely trying to impress with my family.
When I passed an exam.

When I was in a bus on my way to the examination centre, a man     
sitting opposite me kept looking at me continously.  I did not know   
what was wrong.  When I reached the  centre I started strolling around

have forgotten to zip up your trousers."  I was at a loss to say anything   
and I felt very embarrassed.  When I thought of the bus incident I felt   
even more ashamed.

I knew a girl so lovely that everyone would like her.  But she  
refused to accept my Christmas present and I tried to forget  
her.
Being insulted in public for the wrong reason.

I was walking home from a place on southside and I live on  
Northside and I was followed. I headed my most direct route.
When my sister was very ill and was admitted to the hospital.

When I scored the third goal to my own side at a football match

defeated.

While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would not

I put in two years of hard work and it was neither looked at nor

I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove into

afraid.

The situation in which I felt happiest in my life was when

Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.
Thinking about friends overseas.

her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted  
to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous  
way. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long  
time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had  
been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw  
how much she had worried (herself).

I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent  
words.

I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front of  
members of my peer group while still at school.
When my grandmother died.

One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I  
did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had  
a bad conscience and felt guilty.
Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.

One saturday night I did some meaningless work and went to bed

sleeping even though I had work to do and I missed the Sunday  
service.

When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart and  
respiration).
When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.
When I hurt my sisters for no reason at all.

Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a  
lie.

When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our  
mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my  
classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first  
mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more  
than that and I put down "very good" for fear of being scolded.  
Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for  
what I had done.

I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day  
in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold  
for half an hour.

I met a friend in a discotheque. he was with a girl and he told  
me that she was not his girlfriend.  I, to say something,  
commented that she must be a viscious woman.  He then told me  
that she was his girl.

When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for  
it.
When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.

When I decided to take a week s holiday without consulting the  
family first.
Some students talking when other people are having a nap.

Once a friend had pushed me and I had fallen on to a window which  
then broke.  I was taken to tthe principal's office and he  
accused me of having broken the window.

I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying  
in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it

- and it started crying again.
Class leader getting me to do things he did not want to do.

That evening when I opened the songbook while I was singing the  
song "Those were the days" that guilt feeling became stronger.   
The lyrics described well - I was really wrong.  The wish that I  
had made was really bad. If she were with me I would really be  
happy and we would play happily together like the days in  
secondary school and she would not be disappointed and gloomy  
because of me.

A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legs  
were broken. His shoe was thrown about 50 yards after the  
accident.

When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until  
midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports  
at the police station.

I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my  
parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived  
self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as

Students on campus were unnecessarily creating trouble just to  
heckle the authorities - not to achieve something concrete, but

A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the

forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.
I locked myself out.

I was spending a few days at my aunt's place.  One night I got  
home very late, I had told them I was going to a party but I went  
to another place.  They were very worried.

Sincerely I'm a very timid guy and so even in very simple  
situations sometimes I am ashamed.

I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil)

One night a friend found out that I dumped one girl for another

When I shouted at my mother when she was nervous and depressed.

It was when we were beaten or lost the football match by 5-1 and

It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to  
graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel

It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk

I felt fear of what could have happened.

The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea saying

When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.

When I found out some family friends were embezzelling the

When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.

My best friend had failed Exams. She had to leave and so we got  
separated.
[ When some difference of opinion occurs in a silly situation.]

I attended a ceremony in Denmark which is comparable to our

When i was asked to be a child's godmother.
When I imitated a teacher behind his back - walking very silly.

I could not take care of my mother when she was admitted to a hospital   
for surgery, I continued my studies as I could not get leave.

I was very pleased and happy when my older sister came home from  
living somewhere out of town and I hadn't seen her for months. We  
are very close sisters.

In the past I used to think that my mother was a very nagging  
person.  When I started living at the hostel we had little time  
to meet each other.  Whenever I went home she would take care  
of me.  I gradually realized that what she had done was for my  
own good.  So very time I saw her I felt guilty.

When I heard of the death of a friend who had just finished her  
training I felt very sad for she was young.

In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I  
played very badly.

Someone asked me to do something and I made up an excuse and said  
no. I then went and didn't the same thing with someone else and  
hoped the first person never found out.

That was what I felt when I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian  
Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.

I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break our  
relationship. Our relationship lasted two years, we shared  
everything and all this was finished.

My elder sister whom I love very much was leaving for the           
West Indies for two years and I was staying behind.

When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that I  
had been accepted at university.
People spitting in railway stations.

In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of me  
who was asking for directions in a thick voice.  When she got up to  
go a disgusting smell of urine came from her.  I felt that I  
would choke.

When parents of a certain girl refused to let me marry their  
daughter because I was not fit to do so yet the girl accepted  
everything and later she followed what her parents insisted and

At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me  
and nobody mentioned anything about that.

I felt disgusted while studying for my applied psychology and  
mental testing papers in B.A.

When after a party celebrating a friend's 21st birthday - upon  
leaving I found 10 people outside throwing up and further 4  
unconscious.

Right before I went to a concert with my last boyfriend he told  
me that although he told me he was going to take me to the  
concert, he didn't want to see me anymore. After that we stayed  
overnight and I said "well, when he leaves me I will be ruined  
for awhile, but for now we're together." I woke up in his arms  
and it was the happiest moment of my life.

When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against the  
door.  I thought that I was going to fall out.

I had a short lasting sexual relationship with someone I didn't  
love.
A close friend of the family died.

When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to  
rest.
When I first came to the campus.
Once I had some homework to do and I did not do it.

My mother and her friends were speaking badly about my father  
when they were separated, and my brothers and sisters and myself  
were allowed to listen.

Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for  
my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years  
of my life.
When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.
I was accused of a misdemeanour, unjustly.

The people on my floor last year were very close. This year 4 of  
our best friends live together in an apartment. My boyfriend and  
I dropped by on one of their birthdays and stayed for dinner. Two  
other people had already been invited and I felt uncomfortable  
and unwanted. Then I realized I was the one who always called  
them and they rarely call me.

When my mother slapped me in the face, I felt anger at that  
moment.

When I found out that the seat in the coach that I had booked had  
been sold to somebody else.

[ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him

When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me

My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second  
month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt

I felt it when playing I pushed my brother and he fell down  
cutting himself in pieces of tile.

The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother and  
father divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probably  
move to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will be  
sold (I myself have not been living at home for the past six

I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well  
prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I  
couldn't answer.

I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had good  
food, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warm  
atmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well.  
I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with her  
giving her a neck massage.

I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but  
I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt, disappointed,  
lonely and deserted.
Finding out some people had been talking about me at my back.

When I received the results from my final examination - Higher  
School Certificate - and received a mark that was beyond my  
wildest expectations.
When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.

When my cat ran under a car and came home wounded. He could  
hardly walk. I didn't dare to go to a veterinarian because I was  
afraid he would kill him.

The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called   
the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.   
I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining  
school to cool off.

When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my  
certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew  
nothing about this.
Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.
When my mother found out that I smoke maryhuana.

After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great  
joy and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the

One day I got on the bus without any money or season ticket and  
the driver threw me out.
My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.

I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared that  
he was going to cut me off from going to his house as well as  
playing it again.

I broke the gutar of a colleague but as it happened in a moment  
when nobody was present I could escape from the guilt.

I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interview  
a handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went really  
well. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now I  
hope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting them  
down.

I wanted to go to Bhopal for relief work (gas tragedy).  My boss  
simply refused to let me go, I was so angry that the only thought  
that came to my mind was to quit the job.

When I was taking the 11th standard exam, my friend who was sitting  
behind me asked me for some answers.  The teacher looked at us  
just then and scolded both of us.  Everyone started looking at us  
and I felt very guilty.
When I knew about my first job.
I felt extreme joy the day I was baptized. I was one with God.
Made a misjudgement in a football match.

I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted  
when we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why some  
persons like this course.
Angry with my brother, who was making fun of me, teasing me.

When I beat up my brother in order to control him and make him  
obey my parents orders.

One day I went to town to get my grocery.  On my way back, I took  
a mini bus which was full of drunk students.  I felt very  
disgusted.

I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job.   
After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered from  
anxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studies  
were the only alternative.

Death of paternal grandmother to whom I was very close - died of  
cancer.

When I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a big  
glass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.

I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen  
for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some  
ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.

It was at the time of my M.Sc exam, when I was not in a position  
to take the exam after having studied seriously.

When I went to town in a double dekker bus.  The bus was about to  
fall on the way when the driver controlled it.  It had almost  
fallen.
When my cousin passed away.

A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another  
girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years  
and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not  
believe it.
When I heard my sister got in a bad car accident.

By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt  
her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.

I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and  
dangerous driving habit.
When I failed an exam I thought I could pass easily.

While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of the  
cupboard and a china doll.  We were scolded by my father for  
breaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.
Cannot recall the emotion with any force.
Blank.

I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of  
hours.

In a play (secret friend) during the time of the high school I  
had to give a present to a boy and I was very ridiculous because  
of this.

Not succeeding in a cross-country skiing competition, which I  
intended to win.

When I overslept for the second time on the day I had an  
examination.

[ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing

When I had to plunge in a swamp of fetid and stagnant water.

I quarrelled with my brothers (twins) at home on saturday.  One

they are satisfied with their awkward life.  I have tried to  
persuade them very often but have failed.  This time I had a  
fight as they have no voluntary spirit (they did not polish the  
floor).

My elder sister scolded me in front of my younger sisters and  
cousins.  She said that I was very lazy and I felt so sad that I  
cried myself to sleep.
When my uncle died of leukemia at age 35.

While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.  I was  
held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.

When my neighbours accused my brother of stealing their  
rose-bush, I was very angry as he had not touched it at all.

Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't  
wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness  
(and so it is now).

I was very sad when I had to leave persons with whom I had a very  
intense relationship I also had to leave the environment which  
was part of this.

My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show  
the letter the door, which was almost crashed, I felt ashamed.
To fight with a sister and to know that she doesn't care.

I was at home and I heard a loud sound of spitting outside the  
door.  I thought that one of my family members would step on the spit  
and bring the germs in the house.

When I came to know that my exams were on two successive days and  
that there was very little time (about 9-10 hours) to study in

I greeted and embraced the wrong person thinking that it was my  
friend.

When I was working in Delhi, I had gone alone to see the hostel  
where I would be residing.

When my mother asked me to do a job for her which does not

I did not do well in one of the subjects last term.   I was  
afraid that I would fail.  My result was a grade D, though it was  
not good I still passed.  I felt more comfortable then.

I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for  
them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of  
them cut up some material I flared up.

When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I  
had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.

When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he  
had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should  
not have been punished for it.

My girlfriend mentioned a certain girl's name who was my girl  
some time back and she is no longer mine that she said she was  
still mine.

When I failed the twelveth standard exams I was ashamed at  
having to see my parents later.

Eating the last remains of dinner that someone else (unknown to  
me) had claimed.
When I beat up my son for having beaten up his sister.

When I finished a relation after four years, leading to much  
sorrow for the other one and myself ("although it was the best  
solution").

When I used to go to my chief asking about any doubt about the job  
and he didn't care, didn't answer me, leaving me speaking alone.

I feel disgust towards those who are responsible for the death of  
others.

I had fixed a meeting with my classmates and I missed it as I was  
tired.  Besides everyone at the meeting was a stranger to me and

When I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).

Stopped at lights in Mangere late one Friday night on way home

I had a very short term romance during the summer vacations.  When

When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and

A series about Freud was shown on TV.  In it, a tampon had been  
set in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there.  After great  
pain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleeding

When I saw several people washing their car with water from a  
drain.
I was so angry with a patient who refused to take drugs.

My joy was the joy of meeting again.  My husband came home after  
having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway  
station to meet him.
Always when I am well succeded.
When I dated my friend's boyfriend after they had broken up.

My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think the  
most pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as the  
sun rose.
When I got engaged to a boy of my choice.
When felt lonely about writing my family.

When a person whom I had invited did not come on the appointed  
day and time.

On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's  
car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was  
forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The  
other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.

Every year during carnival I am very joyful I have an intense  
feeling of happiness then.

At a lack of love of my father for my mum, sadness for him more  
than anyone else because he does not realise how much love and  
happiness there could be between them, and is, and how much he is  
damaging himself apart from mum.

My boss on the job failed to keep his promise about something he  
knew was extremely important to me.
I felt sadness when my grandfather died.

I don't know why suddenly I thought that what I was feeling for  
my boyfriend was not really love. After almost three years being  
together, this matter of fact shaked me and I felt a great sorrow

During an informal discussion I contributed a lot even though I  
had not spent much time studying.  Whenever someone said that  
someone was not paying attention, or that he had too many other  
things to do, or that the persoon was not trying his best, I  
would feel ashamed.

When I got through the examination for my driver licence, and  
when I finished I knew I had passed it.

To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination,  
I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the

I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend, who had  
failed.  I wished that I had helped him.

One year, when I went to a camp, I was chased by a dog.  I tried  
hard and finally managed to escape from it.  My torch suddenly  
went off and we talked about ghost stories and I thought that  
there were ghosts.

I was keeping a friend's Library book which went overdue. My  
friend was charged for the delay in returning the book to the  
Library. I felt guilty when I realised I was responsible.
When someone does something wrong which affects me negatively.
[ When friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]

My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers  
having walks with their children.

I was in the cafeteria at the university and a class-mate told me  
that a friend of hers had had all her teeth taken out because of  
an infection caused by her eating a rat's nail in her hamburger.

Not brave enough to take up a challenge in a group discussion.

A film on zombies.

Winning a game after a long time of losing.
